intro: Allantodia fieldingiana, commonly known as the Fielding's allantodia, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers that bloom in shades of white and yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in high-altitude environments. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is known for its delicate, fragrant blossoms. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
